messages.content: what does meh-yo meh-yo mean in mandrain chinese?

In Mandarin Chinese, "meh-yo meh-yo" (which might be spelled as "沒有 沒有" in Pinyin) sounds similar to "méiyǒu méiyǒu" (没有 没有). 

"没有" (méiyǒu) translates to "no" or "not have."

When repeated, "没有 没有" could emphasize the negation or mean "there isn’t any" or "there are none."

However, the pronunciation "meh-yo" might not be an accurate transliteration, and the exact meaning or usage can depend on context or regional accents. If you meant a different phrase, please provide more context or the correct Pinyin spelling for a more accurate explanation.

airbnb esta como a 90 o 95$ por dia. lo tengo con precio inteligente, pero avisame si te animas a visitar.  te lo doy gratis!!!
(si hay espacio. haha. te mando el enlace)

¡Claro! Aquí tienes una traducción y respuesta en inglés basada en tu mensaje en español:

---

Translation:
"Airbnb is about $90 or $95 per day. I have it with Smart Pricing, but let me know if you feel like visiting. I'll give it to you for free!!!
(If there is space. Haha. I'll send you the link.)"

---

Response in English:
"Hi there!

Thank you so much for the kind offer! $90 or $95 per day sounds reasonable with Smart Pricing. I really appreciate the gesture of offering it for free if there's space. That’s very generous of you. Please do send me the link, and I'll check it out to see if I can plan a visit.

Best regards,
[Your Name]"

---

I hope this helps! If you have any other specific needs or questions, feel free to ask.
We'd pay full price in spanish

Sure, here's how you can say "We'd pay full price" in Spanish:

"Pagaríamos el precio completo."

If you want to incorporate it naturally into your previous message, you could say:

---

"¡Hola!

Gracias por la oferta tan amable! El precio de $90 o $95 por día con Precio Inteligente suena razonable. Agradecemos mucho el gesto de ofrecérnoslo gratis si hay espacio, pero pagaríamos el precio completo. Por favor, mándame el enlace para que pueda verlo y planear una visita.

Saludos cordiales,
[Tu Nombre]"

---

This maintains the politeness while conveying that you are willing to pay the full price.
No. No te preocupes! Me avisas cuando quieras!

¡Claro! Aquí tienes cómo decir "No. No te preocupes! Me avisas cuando quieras!" en inglés:

---

"No. Don’t worry about it! Just let me know whenever you want!"

---

Here's how you can incorporate it into a longer message if needed:

---

"Hi! 

No. Don’t worry about it! Just let me know whenever you want. 

Best regards, 
[Your Name]"

---

This keeps the casual and friendly tone you have in your original message.
De nada, ¡me alegra poder ayudarte! Si tienes alguna otra pregunta o necesitas más traducciones, no dudes en decírmelo. ¡Muchas gracias!
